basics.name: Elizabeth Hudson
basics.label: Paraprofessional at Stratton Elementary School
basics.summary: Writer, reader, information enthusiast. Into reducing uncertainty. Currently pursuing a newfound passion for quantitative thinking of all stripes.

work.name: Silver Lining Learning
summary: Assisted in the creation of data visualization tools for client school districts across the country.
Wrote a Python/SQL pipeline to automatically ingest and analyze survey responses for school districts.

work.name: Wellesley College
summary: Located digital and physical materials in the Wellesley databases to fill requests.
Found, requested, received, and returned materials from partner libraries across New England for Wellesley students and faculty.
Assisted with shelving in the main stacks.

work.name: Varsity Tutors
summary: Worked one-on-one with 6th-12th grade students at various levels of Latin proficiency.
Designed study plans and curricula to help prepare students for the AP Latin exam.
Developed students' translation skills by reading ancient authors, including Vergil, Jerome, Horace, and Catullus.
Maintained a consistent client rating of 4.9 out of 5 stars.

work.name: Archdiocese of San Antonio
summary: Collected and analyzed school enrollment data on a weekly basis.
Conducted the annual NCEA school census.
Developed virtual curricula for use by K-12 teachers during the COVID-19 pandemic.
Designed promotional materials for Catholic Schools events and resources.

work.name: Wellesley College
summary: Tutored Wellesley students in Latin and Greek at the beginner, intermediate, and advanced levels.
